page.title: 01NEW ABBEY - INTRODUCTION
page.content: This area lies 7 miles south of Dumfries on the A710 (Solway Coast) road. It was formerly in the county of the Stewartry of Kirkcudbright but, since regionalisation, has been in the district of Nithsdale in Dumfries and Galloway Region. A burn called the New Abbey Pow cuts through the area and flows into the River Nith estuary on the east. This estuary is part of the Solway Firth and has dangerous quick-sands and fast running tides. The ruins of Sweetheart Abbey have, for hundreds of years, dominated the village of New Abbey (population 600) and now attract many tourists. There are fine woodlands, including magnificent Scots pines, in the district. The climate is mild and pleasant.
